purpose.simpara: Returns the number of uncaught exceptions.

para.termdef: A direct predecessor of an evaluation X is an evaluation Y that satisfies the following conditions; Y is sequenced before X, and there is no other evaluation Z such that Z is sequenced before X and Y is sequenced before Z.

The number of uncaught exceptions is a natural number defined for every evaluation in a well-formed program. The number of uncaught exceptions is defined as 0 for evaluations that do not have any direct predecessor. The number of uncaught exceptions is defined as n + 1 for an evaluation if it is one of a throw expression and the number of uncaught exceptions for one of the direct predecessors of the evaluation is n. The number of uncaught exceptions is defined as n - 1 for an evaluation if it is one of the initialization for the formal parameter of a catch clause and the number of uncaught exceptions for one of the direct predecessor of the evaluation is n.

footnote.simpara: It cannot happen that the numbers of uncaught exceptions are different among the direct ancestors of an evaluation in any well-defined program.
